entries.description: The ability of machines or computer systems to perform tasks...

entries.title: Artificial Intelligence (AI)
entries.description: The ability of machines or computer systems to perform tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as learning, reasoning, and problem-solving.

entries.title: Computer Science
entries.description: The study of computers, how they work, and how they can be used to solve problems.

entries.title: Neural Networks
entries.description: Computer programs designed to work a bit like the human brain. They help machines recognize patterns and make smart choices.

entries.title: Pattern Recognition
entries.description: The ability of AI systems to detect and interpret patterns in data, such as recognizing faces or voices.

entries.title: Data Processing
entries.description: The collection, analysis, and interpretation of data to extract useful information.

entries.title: Mimic
entries.description: Copy, act like, or explain: "AI tries to copy how the human brain works."

entries.title: Algorithm
entries.description: Set of instructions or in other words: "A recipe of steps the computer follows to solve a problem."

entries.title: Data
entries.description: Facts and numbers collected to understand something.

entries.title: Recognise
entries.description: Notice, identify: E.g.: "Your phone can notice your face."

entries.title: Efficiently
entries.description: Quickly and correctly – simplify for clarity.

entries.title: Intelligence (in “Artificial Intelligence”)
entries.description: Smart thinking – give examples like solving puzzles or answering questions.

entries.title: Process (in “processing language/images”)
entries.description: Work on, handle, or explain: "It works on the words to understand them."

entries.title: Domain (in “Domains of AI”)
entries.description: Area or part – "Different parts of AI that do special jobs."

entries.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
entries.description: Teaching computers to understand what we say and write.

entries.title: Predict/predictions
entries.description: Guess based on facts: E.g.: "When YouTube guesses what video you will like next."

entries.title: Patterns
entries.description: Repeated things – explain: "A pattern is something that happens again and again, like your school timetable."

entries.title: Voice assistant
entries.description: A smart tool that listens and talks back, like Siri or Alexa.

entries.title: Diagnose
entries.description: Find out what is wrong – "Doctors use AI to find out what sickness someone might have."

entries.title: Translate
entries.description: Change language – "Turning Hindi into English using Google Translate."

entries.title: Autonomous (in vehicles)
entries.description: Self-driving – "A car that drives by itself without a person."
Document Description
The ability of machines or computer systems to perform tasks...

entries.title: Data
entries.description: Information like numbers, words, or pictures.

entries.title: Pattern
entries.description: Something that repeats or is always similar.

entries.title: Algorithm
entries.description: A set of steps that tells a computer what to do.

entries.title: Spam Filter
entries.description: A tool that keeps unwanted emails out of your inbox.

entries.title: Virtual Assistant
entries.description: A program like Siri or Alexa that helps you by listening to commands.

entries.title: Feedback
entries.description: Information about how well something is done and can be used to improve.

entries.title: Training
entries.description: Practice that helps AI get better at a task.

entries.title: Neurons
entries.description: Special brain cells that help us think and remember.

entries.title: General AI
entries.description: An AI that can think like a human in many areas. (It does not exist yet).

entries.title: Super AI
entries.description: A futuristic idea of an AI smarter than all humans.

entries.title: Teachable Machine
entries.description: A tool that helps machines learn using examples (Google’s AI tool).
Document Description
The ability of machines or computer systems to perform tasks...

entries.title: Self-driving cars
entries.description: Vehicles that use AI to drive without human control by recognising traffic signals, pedestrians, and obstacles.

entries.title: Traffic Flow Management
entries.description: AI-powered systems that adjust traffic lights and routes in real-time to reduce congestion and improve road efficiency.

entries.title: AI Influencers
entries.description: Digital characters created using AI that act like human influencers by posting content, interacting with followers, and sharing trends.

entries.title: Digital Celebrities
entries.description: AI-generated personalities that appear on social media and gain followers like human influencers.

entries.title: Simulation
entries.description: A computer-created experience that feels real, like a 3D volcano eruption.
Document Description
The ability of machines or computer systems to perform tasks...

entries.title: Prompt
entries.description: A clear question or instruction you give to an AI so that it knows how to help you.

entries.title: Prompting
entries.description: The way we ask or give instructions to an AI to get useful and correct answers.

entries.title: Role
entries.description: Tells the AI who it should act: for example, a teacher, doctor, or chef.

entries.title: Task
entries.description: What you want the AI to do: for example, tell a story, solve a Math problem, or explain a topic.

entries.title: Context
entries.description: Extra information that helps the AI understand what you are asking about.

entries.title: Language
entries.description: How simple or difficult the words should be, depending on who will read the answer.

entries.title: Word Limit
entries.description: How many words the AI should use while answering.

entries.title: Tone
entries.description: The style or mood of the answer, it can be funny, friendly, serious, or formal.

entries.title: Specific Prompt
entries.description: A prompt that gives clear and detailed instructions so that the AI understands exactly what to do.

entries.title: Vague Prompt
entries.description: A prompt which is not clear can confuse AI and give answers you do not want.

entries.title: Accurate Response
entries.description: An answer that is correct, helpful, and matches what you asked.
Document Description
The ability of machines or computer systems to perform tasks...

entries.title: Personalisation
entries.description: Giving each person something that matches his or her own needs or likes.

entries.title: Repetitive Tasks
entries.description: Working repeatedly on the same thing, like typing or answering the same question.

entries.title: Efficiency
entries.description: Doing things quickly, correctly, and with less waste.

entries.title: Dangerous Environments
entries.description: Places where it is risky or unsafe for people to work, such as deep oceans or outer space.

entries.title: Ethical Dilemma
entries.description: A situation where people must decide what is right or wrong.

entries.title: Data Privacy
entries.description: Keeping people’s personal information safe and used only with permission.

entries.title: Bias
entries.description: Treating some people better or worse unfairly based on the data.
Document Description
The ability of machines or computer systems to perform tasks...

entries.title: Ethical
entries.description: Related to what is right or wrong in human behaviour.

entries.title: Intrusion
entries.description: Entering or using something without permission.

entries.title: Bias
entries.description: An unfair preference for or against a group of people.

entries.title: Discrimination
entries.description: Mistreating people based on characteristics like gender, race, or age.

entries.title: Transparency
entries.description: Being open and clear about how something works.

entries.title: Accountability
entries.description: Taking responsibility for actions and decisions.

entries.title: Autonomous
entries.description: Able to operate on its own without human control.

entries.title: Displacement
entries.description: The process of replacing something, in this case, jobs being replaced by AI.

entries.title: Empathy
entries.description: The ability to understand and share someone else's feelings.

entries.title: Digital Divide
entries.description: The gap between people who have easy access to technology and those who do not.

entries.title: Inclusive
entries.description: Making sure that everyone has equal opportunities and access.
Document Description
The ability of machines or computer systems to perform tasks...

entries.title: Automate
entries.description: To make a process work by itself without human help.

entries.title: Internet of Things (IoT)
entries.description: A system where everyday objects are connected to the internet, allowing them to communicate and perform tasks automatically.

entries.title: Processing
entries.description: The action of handling and analyzing data to make decisions or perform tasks.

entries.title: Sensor
entries.description: A device that detects and measures changes in the environment, like temperature or motion.

entries.title: Smart Thermostat
entries.description: A device that automatically controls the temperature in a room, making adjustments based on the weather or your habits.

entries.title: Transforming
entries.description: Changing something completely, usually in a positive way.
Document Description
The ability of machines or computer systems to perform tasks...

entries.title: Assemble
entries.description: To put together different parts to create a complete product.

entries.title: Actuator
entries.description: A part that moves the robot, like its muscles.

entries.title: Automation
entries.description: Doing tasks without needing a person all the time.

entries.title: Control System
entries.description: The part of a robot that processes information and makes decisions, like a brain.

entries.title: Humanoid
entries.description: Having a shape or appearance similar to a human.

entries.title: Mechanical
entries.description: Related to machines or moving parts.

entries.title: Robotics
entries.description: The field of designing, building, and programming robots.

entries.title: Sensors
entries.description: Devices that detect changes in the environment, like light, sound, or movement.

entries.title: Welding
entries.description: Joining metal parts by melting them together.
Document Description
